page.title: 07Ecology
page.content: {Natural History,Glanwydden.} This rural area is rich in ecology and many local people take a keen interest.Wooded areas have a variety of{trees}such as Oak,Ash,Beech,Sycamore and even Elm although these have been destroyed by Dutch Elm disease.There are also coniferous trees in wooded ares.Hedges and woodlands boast a large variety of{wild flowers}such as Dogrose,Honeysuckle,Bluebells, Anenomies,Violets,Vetches and Ragged Robin to name but a few.{Animals which have been spotted are Fox,Mole, Rabbit,Badger,Otter,Rodents,Squirrels, Weasles and Stoats.{Birds}which have been spotted include Magpies,Pheasants Sparrows,Robins,Jackdaws,Bluetits, Housemartins and Swallows.
